intro: Junellia echegarayi var. cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaf junellia, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are often a deep green with a velvety texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Junellia echegarayi var. cordifolia is considered an endangered species.
